alert.note: Alert for Amherst; Appomattox; Bedford; Campbell; City of Lynchburg (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 14 at 2:34AM EDT until July 14 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Blacksburg has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Amherst County in central Virginia... Southwestern Appomattox County in central Virginia... Northeastern Campbell County in central Virginia... The City of Lynchburg in central Virginia... Northeastern Bedford County in south central Virginia... * Until 500 AM EDT. * At 234 AM EDT, trained weather spotters reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in the City of Lynchburg and along US 460. Several roads in the area are closed with 4 to 5 feet of water flowing over them. Between 5 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lynchburg... Rustburg... Concord... Forest... Bocock... Madison Heights... Timberlake... This includes the following locations... Liberty University and Lynchburg Airport. This includes the following streams and drainages... Falling River, Bear Creek, Buttom Creek, Dreaming Creek, Burton Creek, Carters Creek, Elk Creek, Buffalo Creek, Blackwater Creek, Chestnut Branch and Beaverpond Branch. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
